description: From Italian risentimento, or French ressentiment from an archaic usage of the verb ressentir via Old French sentir, from Latin sentiō, sentīre (“to feel”). Doublet of resentiment and ressentiment.

entries.meaning: Anger or displeasure stemming from belief that one has been wronged or betrayed by others; indignation.
(obsolete) The state of holding something in the mind as a subject of contemplation, or of being inclined to reflect upon it; feeling; impression.
